title: About Our Newspaper
content:
Welcome to The Campus Chronicle

The Campus Chronicle is the official student newspaper of University. Founded in 1923, we have been serving the campus community for over 100 years.

Our Mission

To inform, engage, and empower the campus community through accurate, thoughtful, and independent journalism. We provide a platform for student voices and report on issues that matter to our readers.

Our Team

Our staff consists entirely of students - from writers and editors to photographers and designers. We're passionate about journalism and committed to serving our fellow students.

Get Involved

Interested in joining? We welcome writers, photographers, designers, and business staff. No experience necessary - just enthusiasm and commitment. Email us at join@campuschronicle.com for more information.

title: Submission Guidelines
content:
Write for Us

We welcome submissions from all students, faculty, and staff. Here's how to submit your work:

News Articles

Send news tips and article pitches to news@campuschronicle.com. Please include sources and contact information.

Opinion Pieces

Op-eds should be 500-800 words and address current issues. Include a brief author bio and photo. Send to opinion@campuschronicle.com.

Arts & Culture

Reviews, profiles, and features about arts on campus. Email arts@campuschronicle.com.

Sports

Game recaps, player profiles, and sports features to sports@campuschronicle.com.

Photography

We're always looking for campus photos. Email high-resolution images to photo@campuschronicle.com with caption and credit information.

Deadlines

Submissions for the weekly print edition are due by Wednesday at 5 PM. Online submissions are accepted on a rolling basis.

title: Join Our Team
content:
Become a Staff Member

The Campus Chronicle is always looking for talented and motivated students to join our team. No prior experience necessary - we'll train you!

Available Positions

  • Staff Writers: Cover news, features, sports, or arts
  • Copy Editors: Review and edit articles
  • Photographers: Capture campus events and portraits
  • Designers: Layout and graphics for print and web
  • Social Media Team: Manage our online presence
  • Business Staff: Advertising and circulation

Benefits

  • Gain real journalism experience
  • Build your portfolio
  • Flexible hours that work with your class schedule
  • Make friends and connections across campus
  • Free pizza at our weekly meetings!

How to Apply

Email us at join@campuschronicle.com with your name, year, major, and area of interest. We'll invite you to our next new member orientation.
